ygData.subject: RE: Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
ygData.msgSnippet: Slightly off topic : If even a 10th of what I ve read about AC can be believed, I don t think Verant will have much to worry about.  Granted, they are going to
ygData.messageBody:
Slightly off topic : If even a 10th of what I've read about AC can be
believed, I don't think Verant will have much to worry about. Granted, they
are going to lose some players to AC, but I don't think it will be as bad as
the migration from UO to EQ (which I heard was fairly respectable).

Desmei Sightblinder
Lvl 30 Bard [Povar]

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin [mailto:wethington@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, November 02, 1999 1:33 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Undead drops in Kithicor
>
>
> From: "Kevin" <wethington@...>
>
> Methinks you are being a bit harsh on Verant. The Kithicor
> and Lake Rathe
> events are probably testing grounds for some kind of changes
> to the zones.
> Verant has so few people on the Test Server that they have to
> do things on
> live servers to see how things will actually work. Trust me
> Verant has 1.5
> million reasons per month to want you to be happy. With the
> retail release
> of Asheron's Call yesterday I think Verant is going to be
> very aggressive in
> retaining and growing their current player base. I don't
> envy them having
> to compete against Microsoft.
>
>
>
> ----- Original Message -----
>
> > From: Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...>
> > Side note: everyone in the zone was saying "I hope hope
> leave it this
> > way forever" just like last week in Lake rathe when the pets were
> > spawning like crazy and everypne was saying "I hope it
> stays this way".
> > TWO examples of people LOVING a zone, BOTH of which Verant
> KABONG'ed.
> > Makes you wonder if they really WANT us happy.
> >
> >
> > Uldar Ulfangson
> > 25th bard, Rodcet Nife
>
